docs.snippet: A group of at least six wealthy Republican donors is urging the billionaire Koch brothers to step off the sidelines of the U.S. presidential election to back Donald Trump, arguing they will want influence with the New York businessman they have ha...
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of at least six wealthy Republican donors is urging the billionaire Koch brothers to step off the sidelines of the U.S. presidential election to back Donald Trump, arguing they will want influence with the New York businessman they have harshly criticized if he wins the White House in November.

headline.main: Exclusive: Billionaire Republican Donors Urge Kochs to Back Trump
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Billionaire Republican Donors Urge Kochs to Back Trump

docs.snippet: Eight years ago, Barack Obama cast himself as the rare candidate who could transcend the polarizing "politics of the past" and bridge divides that had left Washington barely functioning for years. Ultimately, the gulf was too wide — if anyth...
docs.lead_paragraph: Eight years ago, Barack Obama cast himself as the rare candidate who could transcend the polarizing "politics of the past" and bridge divides that had left Washington barely functioning for years. Ultimately, the gulf was too wide — if anything, the political climate in the United States worsened.

docs.snippet: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said again Thursday whoever hacked the Democratic National Committee and stole years of internal emails remains a mystery, but private security experts — although not yet any U.S. government agenc...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said again Thursday whoever hacked the Democratic National Committee and stole years of internal emails remains a mystery, but private security experts — although not yet any U.S. government agencies — say they found persuasive clues that point to hacking groups whose previous targets track closely with the strategic interests of Russia's government, especially its civilian and military intelligence and security agencies.

headline.main: Clues in DNC Hacking Point to Russia, Despite Trump Claims
headline.print_headline: Clues in DNC Hacking Point to Russia, Despite Trump Claims

docs.snippet: He took a long view in his convention speech, stressing Americans’ common bonds, consistent with the spirit that drove his historic presidency....
docs.lead_paragraph: He took a long view in his convention speech, stressing Americans’ common bonds, consistent with the spirit that drove his historic presidency.
docs.abstract: Editorial lauds Pres Obama's steadfast optimism about America's ability to move past racial and political division, as exhibited by his speech at Democratic National Convention and his transformative tenure in Oval Office; contends Obama has held fast to his vision and taken long view, even in time of fear and violence, tenacity that will ultimately shape his legacy in its animation of American spirit.

headline.main: President Obama and the Long March
headline.print_headline: President Obama and the Long March
